140739480.review:
This e-commerce game set in a magical world where humans and monsters are at war is definitely a unique concept that caught my attention. Helping a rabbit fairy expand her online store selling homegrown carrots while uncovering hidden secrets sounds like a fun and engaging experience.

However, as I played the game, I found that the content became repetitive and lacked the fresh feeling that I expected. Although the game's initial concept was intriguing, the gameplay quickly became monotonous and lacked the depth that I was hoping for. The game's focus on expanding the online store and becoming a successful entrepreneur is admirable, but it could have been executed in a more engaging and dynamic way.

123630701.review:
+非常好的演出，尤其男主角
+自然的时局影射
+细心的模因观察，笑料百出
-过于紧凑难以完成的支线任务
-女主角性格扁平（包括明线与暗线）
-悲剧与喜剧调理失衡，导致后半段剧情急转直下但缺少呼应
-失败的符号化，云里雾里的蓝图构想
*无产大同固然是个美梦，但人类生存本能决定了这是完全不可能实现的
综：接近两年打磨勇气可嘉，但文本稚嫩，思想固化，天真化。人物脸谱化严重。不推荐。
6/10

118367526.review: One of the greatest visual novels

118220472.review:
If you like satire, social commentary, and good writing, then this game is legendary.

Especially if you understand Chinese culture, there are cultural references. You will find no shortage of references, jokes, puns, and occasionally, inspirational quotes that make me want to make the world a better place. This game ponders: Is it worth spending our time toiling for as much money as possible, or should we aim to spend more time doing what we love? Is that our decision to make, or does society at large compel us in a certain direction? Are we steering the future of society in the right direction?

Except its not boring like what I said. Its satirical, emotional, sympathetic, critical, and funny.  All delivered with good dialogue, pacing and character development. (With amazing voice acting I might add)

Just play the game, I highly highly recommend it, the narrative is unparalleled. Some games that cost 2x-6x this price don't have half as much content and thought behind it. Definitely one of the best purchases I have made on steam.

112475639.review:
Bunny eShop is an adaptation of sino-american trade war and the semiconductor embargo(and to a degree last few decades of Chinese history) in a moe visual novel format in an alternate universe inspired by Chinese fantasy stories, it tells a nuanced story from the perspective of ordinary Chinese people. It is an anti-capitalism masterpiece, and a great introduction into understanding Chinese nationalism.

This game is fully voiced professionally with fully fleshed-out and lovable characters. Overall the plot is captivating, but the ending does feel like a missed opportunity, which is perhaps inevitable considering it's an adaptation of an on-going real-world event. Another flaw of the game is how running the shop have pretty much nothing to do with the plot during the latter half of the game, even though you could still put a lot of effort into it, so it kind of feels like all that effort has gone to waste.

112349069.review: Not recommend. e-Shop gameplay has nothing to do with the plot progress while some behavior of characters are unreasonable(Miao-Ye). the developer wants to reveal his political views in the guise of an anime game, which makes me feel disgusted. I admire his insight of Chinese society and regulation. Also the game itself is beautifully crafted (UI, seiyuu, arts) but assembled in chaos(too many aspects without emphasis). The script writer wanna dive deep in politics but remain such superficial, any forms of ignorance in truth nor criticism pretending in a vulnerable position are not welcome for me.

106085055.review:
Don't buy this game if you are not a gal game fan.

I had expected that it's a strategy game. But in fact no strategy needed, just follow what the dialogues require us to do. It's only a visual novel, not a simulated business game at all.

As a gal game, it's okay, but the title and descriptions may misunderstand other players as a e-business simulator.

The game reflects some aspects of Chinese society. Until now it doesn't support English. Buy this game ONLY IF you wanna learn Chinese culture or language.

102733518.review:
Good game which weaved amusement and satire together. It has some insight into society despite the moe girls.

What cut both ways is that the game is overflowed with Chinese pop culture memes and political metaphors. While native speakers enjoy this with a enigmatic smile, those of a different culture background, even who live in China but have little knowledge about some sub-culture sphere, will struggle to figure out the meaning of some cryptic phrases.

This game is suitable for most players: If a player is unfamiliar with all the political ideals the authors want to conveys, he/she can still take pleasure from the casual carrot-selling process with the cute rabbit(s). Whereas for those who want to view the game in a more political angle, the game also gives enough detail, provided they understand the puzzles between phrases.
